item.description:
Our consensus at the last meetup was to head to Middletown for our next event.  It has been a while, and Middletown has a lot to offer.  Last time, we dined at Mikado, so this time we will try Osaka.  It is near the movie theater, right on Main Street, a bit south of Mikado but in the same (east) side of the street.  Lots of parking in the back or on the street in front.  Scott and Bonnie will give you a warm welcome.  After sushi, a stroll down Main Street might be fun?  There are good ice cream and coffee options...Pralines, Cold Stone, Javapalooza, Klekolo...

Osaka info:http://www.idine.com/details.htm?merchantId=94104

Middletown Info: http://www.cityofmiddletown.com/ShoppingDining/shopping_&_dinning.htm

Also, just to continue the new tradition of offering a humanitarian opportunity prior to sushi, there is a great benefit I am attending nearby in Middletown that day.  Come eat Caribbean food and support Arm 2 Arm.  They send medical mission to Haitians in refugee camps! 

The timing is perfect..so again I am haveing our sushi meal start at 5:30. 

More info:

Imperial Caribbean Restaurant
will host a fundraising
dinner & open poetry reading
to benefit the Children of Camp Hispaniola

Donation: $20 & $10 for children

Sun., June 26, 2011 - 1 to 4 p.m.
Imperial Caribbean Restaurant
51-28-Shunpike Rd., Cromwell, CT - K Mart Plaza

R. S. V. P.
Executive Chef Marie Jarda 860-613-0005
marc@camphispaniola.org
to donate visit www.camphispaniola.org

More info about the restaurant:

http://www.imperialcaribbe an.com/Imperial_Caribbean/ Welcome.html

http://www.restaurantsct.com/blog/a-haitian-coronation%E2%80%94imperial-caribbean-restaurant-in-cromwell/

Taken from event listing for my humanitarian group:  Please join if you want! http://www.meetup.com/CMEHKA/events/19047801/

group.name: New Haven County Sushi Meetup Group

item.name: Oh the fun ...Oh the sushi...Osaka!
